item.title: where can i get half life 1?
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
dky.tehkingd.u:

On the other hand, does anyone have any mods that will revert from the new forced-HD pack?

In the Steam-version of Half-Life, just go to the Video options and uncheck “Enable HD models if available”.

item.title: where can i get half life 1?
item.dc:creator: imadoofus
item.description:
k3nny1550:

I got my copy of HL1 as part of “Half-Life Platinum Collection,” a box set including both OpFor and Blue Shift, as well as Team Fortress Classic and the original Counter Strike.

Steam read it as an even bigger package and gave me a couple extra games- Deathmatch Classic and Ricochet.

Yes, I own Ricochet. I know, right?

It was like that with my British-copy EA Classics Orange Box disc - I also got HL2LC and TF2 Beta.

Read full topic

item.title: where can i get half life 1?
item.dc:creator: MSKyuuni
item.description:
k3nny1550:

Rural areas are the best places to look for old and hard-to-find titles.
Unopened copy of Shenmue. Found it for $40 at a used game shop in Cedar Park, Texas.

Shouldn’t have opened it. I should have resold that fucker for $200 instead of playing it and realizing it’s horrible as a game.

Don’t check rural areas in Australia though

item.title: where can i get half life 1?
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
You can get the HD pack the PS2 version used for PC I think. And it apparently cut some stuff out. I remember playing HL on PC after playing it on PC and seeing the soldiers placing grenades on the ground and running away. Never saw that on the PS2 version. Not to mention how much better playing with kb+m is compared to the PS2 controller.

Read full topic
item.source: where can i get half life 1?

item.title: where can i get half life 1?
item.dc:creator: deadlife101
item.description:
You could also try Amazon or ebay or a local Gamestop for the Plastation 2 version of Half-Life, though I don’t really recommend it, the pc version is far better, the only reason to buy the PS2 version would be because of slightly updated graphics, and the co-op expansion that comes with it called Half-Life: Decay.

Edit: Didn’t this guy get banned a while ago or something? lol

Read full topic

item.title: where can i get half life 1?
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
^Those, bscly.

The only place you should try it get it is from Steam, mostly because it’s the cheapest and easiest, but also because it’s guaranteed to work. However if you wanna spend more money (upwards of $20 more) then places like Amazon and Ebay have CD-versions. CD Keys may or may not work.

Good luck finding it in a retail store, though. You’d have a higher chance with that if you try smaller game stores as opposed to something more popular and stupid like GameStop.

Read full topic
